pullRequest.title: Search memory leak
pullRequest.bodyText:
Search could leak memory if global ordinals were calculated as part of
a search with low level cancellation enabled. QueryPhase registers a
cancellation on the reader that is never removed, which ends up being
referenced from the global ordinals cache entry. This keeps an indirect
reference to the search context. The main known leak occurs when a
cardinality aggregation is used, a failure occurs during search and the
pages backing the hyperlog++ structure are not recycled when it is closed.
This commit also fixes request breaker adjustment in cardinality
aggregation.

commit.message:
Search memory leak

Search could leak memory if global ordinals were calculated as part of
a search with low level cancellation enabled. Search registers a
cancellation on the reader that is never removed, which ends up being
referenced from the global ordinals cache entry. This keeps an indirect
reference to the search context. The main known leak occurs when a
cardinality aggregation is used and the pages backing the hyperlog++
are not recycled when it is closed.

This commit also fixes request breaker adjustment in cardinality
aggregation.
